body.head: 2022: another year
body.p: What's left to say about the year 2022? I survived it, as did most of those near and dear to me. Despite coming close several times, the UK's current apology for a government did not entirely collapse. I spent most of the year running away, as this blog attests.

list.item: In January and February, I seem to have done a lot of running about between dentists and doctors. I also paid my Covid dues and stayed in bed for a few days. And tried my best to contribute something sensible to the CLS WG3 project on counting "verbs of inner life".
In March I went to Galway, to test my brief (but very enjoyable) reincarnation as an itinerant scholar, as holder of a prestigious CLS INFRA fellowship
In May I went, as usual, to Tours to teach TEI "niveau 2", and then to La Vergne where I stayed till July, with the exception of a brief side trip to Nottingham to enjoy a Belinda concert
In June I went to Lyon to teach a summer school: it was hot
In July I had another brief visit to Galway to wrap up my fellowship alas
In August I escaped to La Vergne again
In mid-September, I came back to the UK perforce, to attend the annual TEI conference in Newcastle
At the end of October, we celebrated (a bit early) our golden wedding anniversary with an extraordinary family holiday in the Forest of Dean

In November I managed to fit in another week in La Vergne, a three day teaching spell in Tours, and a day long meeting in Paris, before joining Lilette for a three week break in Mauritius, not before time.

body.p: It's all in my Google Location History, in glorious detail, but I don't know how to share that.
